subject: Soccer
lead_paragraph: Lava Man, a 7-year-old gelding, was retired as thoroughbred racing’s richest claiming horse after X-rays revealed changes in the horse’s front ankles. Lava Man was claimed for $50,000 at Del Mar in 2004 and finished his career with 17 wins in 46 starts and earnings of $5,268,706. Doug O’Neill claimed the horse for the current owners, Steve Kenly and Jason Wood, and trained him the rest of his career.
